snippet: A judge ruled that the state’s expanded ban on assault weapons was constitutional, but struck down a seven-round limit on magazines.
abstract: Judge William M Skretny of Federal District Court in Buffalo rules that New York's strict new gun laws are constitutional, but strikes down provision forbidding gun owners to load more than seven rounds into a magazine; ruling offers a victory to gun control advocates at the end of year in which efforts to pass new legislation on the federal level suffered a high-profile defeat in Congress.
lead_paragraph: A judge ruled that the state’s expanded ban on assault weapons was constitutional, but struck down a seven-round limit on magazines.

headline.main: U.S. Judge Upholds Most New York Gun Limits
headline.print_headline: U.S. Judge Upholds Most New York Gun Limits
